00001 /**********************************************************************
00002 * $Id$          dac_sinewave_test.c                             2010-06-04
00003 */
00026 #include "lpc17xx_dac.h"
00027 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00028 #include "lpc17xx_pinsel.h"
00029 #include "lpc17xx_gpdma.h"
00030 
00031 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00037 /************************** PRIVATE MACROS *************************/
00039 #define DMA_SIZE                60
00040 #define NUM_SINE_SAMPLE 60
00041 #define SINE_FREQ_IN_HZ 60
00042 #define PCLK_DAC_IN_MHZ 25 //CCLK divided by 4
00043 
00044 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00045 GPDMA_Channel_CFG_Type GPDMACfg;
00046 
00047 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00048 /*********************************************************************/
00053 int c_entry(void)
00054 {
00055         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00056         DAC_CONVERTER_CFG_Type DAC_ConverterConfigStruct;
00057         GPDMA_LLI_Type DMA_LLI_Struct;
00058         uint32_t tmp;
00059         uint32_t i;
00060         uint32_t sin_0_to_90_16_samples[16]={\
00061                         0,1045,2079,3090,4067,\
00062                         5000,5877,6691,7431,8090,\
00063                         8660,9135,9510,9781,9945,10000\
00064         };
00065         uint32_t dac_sine_lut[NUM_SINE_SAMPLE];
00066         /*
00067          * Init DAC pin connect
00068          * AOUT on P0.26
00069          */
00070         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00071         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00072         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00073         PinCfg.Pinnum = 26;
00074         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00075         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00076 
00077         //Prepare DAC sine look up table
00078         for(i=0;i<NUM_SINE_SAMPLE;i++)
00079         {
00080                 if(i<=15)
00081                 {
00082                         dac_sine_lut[i] = 512 + 512*sin_0_to_90_16_samples[i]/10000;
00083                         if(i==15) dac_sine_lut[i]= 1023;
00084                 }
00085                 else if(i<=30)
00086                 {
00087                         dac_sine_lut[i] = 512 + 512*sin_0_to_90_16_samples[30-i]/10000;
00088                 }
00089                 else if(i<=45)
00090                 {
00091                         dac_sine_lut[i] = 512 - 512*sin_0_to_90_16_samples[i-30]/10000;
00092                 }
00093                 else
00094                 {
00095                         dac_sine_lut[i] = 512 - 512*sin_0_to_90_16_samples[60-i]/10000;
00096                 }
00097                 dac_sine_lut[i] = (dac_sine_lut[i]<<6);
00098         }
00099         //Prepare DMA link list item structure
00100         DMA_LLI_Struct.SrcAddr= (uint32_t)dac_sine_lut;
00101         DMA_LLI_Struct.DstAddr= (uint32_t)&(LPC_DAC->DACR);
00102         DMA_LLI_Struct.NextLLI= (uint32_t)&DMA_LLI_Struct;
00103         DMA_LLI_Struct.Control= DMA_SIZE
00104                                                         | (2<<18) //source width 32 bit
00105                                                         | (2<<21) //dest. width 32 bit
00106                                                         | (1<<26) //source increment
00107                                                         ;
00108 
00109         /* GPDMA block section -------------------------------------------- */
00110         /* Initialize GPDMA controller */
00111         GPDMA_Init();
00112 
00113         // Setup GPDMA channel --------------------------------
00114         // channel 0
00115         GPDMACfg.ChannelNum = 0;
00116         // Source memory
00117         GPDMACfg.SrcMemAddr = (uint32_t)(dac_sine_lut);
00118         // Destination memory - unused
00119         GPDMACfg.DstMemAddr = 0;
00120         // Transfer size
00121         GPDMACfg.TransferSize = DMA_SIZE;
00122         // Transfer width - unused
00123         GPDMACfg.TransferWidth = 0;
00124         // Transfer type
00125         GPDMACfg.TransferType = GPDMA_TRANSFERTYPE_M2P;
00126         // Source connection - unused
00127         GPDMACfg.SrcConn = 0;
00128         // Destination connection
00129         GPDMACfg.DstConn = GPDMA_CONN_DAC;
00130         // Linker List Item - unused
00131         GPDMACfg.DMALLI = (uint32_t)&DMA_LLI_Struct;
00132         // Setup channel with given parameter
00133         GPDMA_Setup(&GPDMACfg);
00134 
00135         DAC_ConverterConfigStruct.CNT_ENA =SET;
00136         DAC_ConverterConfigStruct.DMA_ENA = SET;
00137         DAC_Init(LPC_DAC);
00138         /* set time out for DAC*/
00139         tmp = (PCLK_DAC_IN_MHZ*1000000)/(SINE_FREQ_IN_HZ*NUM_SINE_SAMPLE);
00140         DAC_SetDMATimeOut(LPC_DAC,tmp);
00141         DAC_ConfigDAConverterControl(LPC_DAC, &DAC_ConverterConfigStruct);
00142 
00143         // Enable GPDMA channel 0
00144         GPDMA_ChannelCmd(0, ENABLE);
00145 
00146         while (1);
00147 
00148         return 1;
00149 }
00150 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00151    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00152    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00153    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00154    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00155 int main(void)
00156 {
00157     return c_entry();
00158 }

00162 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00163 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00164 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00165 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00166 * @return               None
00167 *******************************************************************************/
00168 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00169 {
00170         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00171          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */

00174         while(1);
00175 }
